pageTitle: Jubilee line track improvements mean no trains between Waterloo and Wembley Park

title.title: Jubilee line track improvements mean no trains between Waterloo and Wembley Park

texts: Due to track replacement work to improve the Jubilee line, it will be suspended between Waterloo and Wembley Park on Saturday and Sunday 24 and 25 September.
The Metropolitan line will also be suspended south of Wembley Park.

Transport for London (TfL) is investing £10 billion over the next five years to improve and expand London's transport network, more than half of that in the Tube. This track work is being carried out by Tube Lines.
Customers for Central London are advised to use Chiltern services from Harrow-on-the-Hill to Marylebone.
Or an express Rail Replacement Bus Service C, which will run non-stop between Wembley Park and Stonebridge Park (for connection with the Bakerloo line).
For passengers wishing to travel between intermediate stations, two further replacement bus services will be operating during the closure.

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["\u003cstrong\u003eService A\u003c/strong\u003e - between Baker Street and Willesden Green calling at all intermediate Jubilee line stations.","\u003cstrong\u003eService B \u003c/strong\u003e - between Willesden Green and Wembley Park calling at Dollis Hill and Neasden stations."]}
Valid Underground tickets will be accepted on local bus services.

Passengers should allow an extra 30 minutes for their journeys.

For 24-hour information on all London travel, please call: 020-7222 1234 or visit TfL's website: www.tfl.gov.uk

{"template":"bulletlist","items":["TfL is investing £10 billion over the next five years to improve and expand London's transport network, more than half of that in the Tube","Tube Lines are responsible for the maintenance and renewal of the Jubilee, Northern and Piccadilly lines."]}
